bulk.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a big mass or shape of something
bulk.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: the great bulk of a building
bulk.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the size of something or someone
bulk.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.
bulk.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: bulk goods are sold or moved in large quantities
bulk.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: the main or largest part of something
bulk.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The change in the tax system will affect the bulk of the population.
The bulk of the meetings would be held in Washington.
bulk.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: if you buy, sell, or make something in bulk, you buy, sell, or make large amounts of it
bulk.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: Small traders are unable to compete with larger companies which buy and sell in bulk.
a bulk shipment of medical supplies
bulk.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: stored loose, not packed in containers
bulk.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: the first grain warehouse at the docks for the storage of grain in bulk
